code.title: Code
code.description: Short, human-readable name for employee. This value is kept synchronized with usr_username and salesrep_number, and so is unique across all three tables emp, usr, and salesrep.

number.title: Number
number.description: Official employee number. This might be used for ID badges, payroll accounting, or other purposes.

wageType.title: Wage Type
wageType.description: The nature of the wage or employment agreement. 'H' indicates this employee is paid on an hourly basis (or some other period) while 'S' indicates this employee is salaried.

wagePeriod.title: Wage Period
wagePeriod.description: The periodicity of wage payment: 'H' for hourly, 'D' for daily, 'W' for weekly, 'BW' for biweekly, 'M' for monthly, 'Y' for yearly.

billingPeriod.title: Billing Period
billingPeriod.description: The periodicity of external rate payment: 'H' for hourly, 'D' for daily, 'W' for weekly, 'BW' for biweekly, 'M' for monthly, 'Y' for yearly.

period.title: Period
period.description: With recur_freq, how often this event recurs. Values are "m" for every minute, "H" for every hour, "D" for daily, "W" for weekly, "M" for monthly, "Y" for yearly, and "C" for customized or complex.

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: With recur_period, how often this event recurs. Values are integers counts of recur_periods. For example, if recur_freq = 2 and recur_period = w then the event recurs every 2 weeks.

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: The first date/time when the event should occur.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: The last date/time when the event should occur. NULL means there is no end date/time and the event should recur forever.

maximum.title: Maximum
maximum.description: The maximum number of recurrence events to create at one time. If this is NULL then when new events are created, a system-wide default will limit the number.

name.description: Name of a human language, taken from the ISO 639-2 documentation

abbreviationLong.title: Abbreviation Long
abbreviationLong.description: ISO 639-2 code for language. Where there is a choice between bibliographic (B) and terminology (T) usage, this value is the T code

errorColor.title: Error Color
errorColor.description: Color to use to mark data that require immediate attention.

warningColor.title: Warning Color
warningColor.description: Color to use to mark data that require attention soon.

emphasisColor.title: Emphasis Color
emphasisColor.description: Color to use to mark data that need to stand out but are not in error.

altEmphasisColor.title: Alt Emphasis Color
altEmphasisColor.description: Color to use to mark data that need to stand out and be differentiated from other emphasized data.

expiredColor.title: Expired Color
expiredColor.description: Color to use to mark data that are no longer current.

futureColor.title: Future Color
futureColor.description: Color to use to mark data that will not be effective until some point in the future.
